articles.name: Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR in Talk now support multiple languages!
articles.title: Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR in Talk now support multiple languages!
articles.body:
As of today, the Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR features are now available in more than 20 different languages. Zendesk customers who offer phone support in other languages than English can now use the Talk features Callback from Queue which to allows customers to request a callback instead of waiting in the queue, or Textback from IVR which provides the option to switch from phone to text, in their own language.

We’ve added drop-downs in the Talk admin pages where you can choose the appropriate language to be used for the specific phone number. The full list of the supported languages can be found in these drop-downs.

How does it work?

In the Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR features the caller is able to press a number for either feature and will then be guided through a number of options.

For example if the caller presses 2 while in the queue waiting for an available agent they will enter the Callback workflow. Here we'll repeat the number that we have for them and walk the caller through the process of either confirming their number or entering a new one, as well as confirming that they wish to request a callback.

It’s these system generated messages for both Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR flows that we’re now giving you the ability to choose the appropriate language for. Greetings for Callback, Callback confirmation, and IVRs can all be customised and uploaded for the same language.

Want more details?

Follow these links for more information on how to configure Callback from Queue and Textback from IVR.

articles.name: Our Knowledge Roundtable shares how they measure self-service
articles.title: Our Knowledge Roundtable shares how they measure self-service
articles.body:
You won't want to miss this Knowledge Manager Roundtable!

This time our expert panel shares how they measure self-service activity and knowledge base usefulness. It's a topic I think we all care about!

Check out what they share in the Roundtable and share your own experiences in comments.

In this Roundtable, you'll read expert advice from:

  • Sherri Anderson, Knowledge Manager, Bold Commerce

    and KCS Program Manager, Republic Wireless

  • Andrei Kamarouski, Business Analytics Director and Co-founder, smm3
  • Zac Garcia, Customer Care Operations, Fossil
  • Mary Paez and Sahar Padesh, Knowledge Manager
    and Support Operations Manager, Veeva
  • Melissa Burch, Online Support Manager, Zendesk

articles.name: Admins can now delete recordings in tickets
articles.title: Admins can now delete recordings in tickets
articles.body:
Zendesk Talk now has two options for managing call recording deletions; admins on all plans can already set up a schedule to have recordings deleted on an interval, and as of today admins can also delete individual recordings on tickets.

To delete a recording from a ticket

  1. In Zendesk Support, select the ticket with the recording.
  2. Next to the recording, click delete recording.
  3. Click OK.
  4. The recording player will be replaced by a label saying "Recording not available".

Please note that a deleted recording is not recoverable. For full details see the updated article on Managing recording options in Zendesk Talk.

articles.name: Zendesk Training Days in Chicago and San Francisco - Early Bird Promo
articles.title: Zendesk Training Days in Chicago and San Francisco - Early Bird Promo
articles.body:
Zendesk Training Days are coming to Chicago and San Francisco!

Join us for a full day of deep-dive product training and hands-on exercises to enhance your Zendesk Administrator skills. Our Customer Advocates will also be onsite to provide live support and help you through any questions or issues. This event is a great opportunity to network with other Zendesk Administrators and share your learnings.

Zendesk training days are designed around two core learning tracks:

Admin 101 - For new Zendesk Support Administrators

Admin 201 - For experienced Zendesk Support Administrators

Register by Feb 2, 2018 with early bird code ztd-chi-500 for Chicago or ztd-sf-500 for San Francisco and take $99 off your registration.

Register for Chicago Training

Register for San Francisco Training

If you’re already a Zendesk master, register to take the Zendesk Support Administrator exam and earn your Certification.

Register for a Certification Exam in Chicago

Register for a Certification Exam in San Francisco

Discount code does not apply to certification exam.

articles.name: Announcing: Sunset Apps Framework v1
articles.title: Announcing: Sunset Apps Framework v1
articles.body:
Beginning August 1st, 2017, Zendesk will no longer accept Marketplace submissions for new apps created using the v1 version of the Zendesk Apps framework, or allow uploads of new private apps using the v1 framework.

Starting March 1st, 2018, no updates to public Marketplace v1 apps or installed private v1 apps will be accepted. The last day to update v1 apps will be February 28th. This is part of a larger effort to migrate existing apps to the new and improved v2 framework.

Know that any installed v1 app will continue to work after March 1st. Any already public v1 marketplace app will also continue to be available and installable. The March 1st change just prevents developers from making updates to already uploaded public or private v1 apps. Emergency security updates to v1 apps may be approved on a case-by-case basis.

If you're developing a new application you must use Apps framework v2. If you currently have a public app using the v1 framework and would like to start migrating it to v2, several resources exist to help:

  • Apps framework v2 documentation
  • Migrating to v2 - This doc provides information on the app scaffold - a tool created to help migrate apps to v2 more easily
  • v2 app tutorial - Build a v2 app from scratch

Additionally, more content will become available pointing out the benefits of the v2 framework and best practices as we get closer to deprecating the use of v1 in public apps. Please subscribe to the Zendesk Developers blog for additional content as it arrives.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this phase-out process or need assistance with a specific migration, please contact api@zendesk.com.

Regards,


Zendesk Platform Team

articles.name: Current and upcoming Zendesk betas
articles.title: Current and upcoming Zendesk betas
articles.body:
For some features we open betas so that you can try out the feature in advance, and also give us feedback and report issues. We value the feedback of our customers and consider it an important part of the our process.

These are our current and upcoming betas:

  • Skills-based routing in Support
  • Knowledge Capture App v2
  • Support Mobile SDK v2 for Android
  • Web Widget Callback
  • Guide Team Publishing
  • Answer Bot multi-language support
  • Web Widget performance
  • Custom Resources API
  • Conference for Talk
  • Call blocking for Talk
  • Help Center unified search results page
  • Analytical Designer for Insights
  • Talk additional numbers now available
  • Credit card redaction for Chat
  • Redesigned iPhone and iPad Chat app

Skills-based routing in Support

Skills-based routing is a new feature we’re building for the Enterprise plan. It’ll let customers automatically match tickets that require specific skills with the agents who have those skills -- improving efficiency and replacing cumbersome workflow configurations. The feature is currently in beta but Enterprise customers can apply for early access.

Sign up for the Skills-based routing beta

Knowledge Capture App v2

We have listened to feedback and made some updates to our Knowledge Capture app. The goal is to rethink the integration and some of the interactions in the app, and make it easier and more intuitive to use.

Learn more about the Knowledge Capture app v2 beta

Support Mobile SDK v2 for Android

The beta provides access to the Support SDK v2 for Android. There are a lot of new and enhanced features in this beta including a modern design with simplified theming and a conversational UI to bring all of the desired Zendesk Support features.

Learn more about the Support Mobile SDK v2 for Android beta

Web Widget Callback

With this beta, Talk customers will be able to enable voice contact options in the Web Widget. Now, with Request a Callback you can control where and when you offer phone support on your website. Alternatively, with Call Us, you can display your phone number and customers can call you.

Learn more about the Web Widget Callback beta

Guide Team Publishing

Team Publishing is a new feature of Guide to allow for a more collaborative workflow for articles. It includes article workflow states to support a publishing workflow, article changes for making updates to an article without affecting the live article, and article assignment for making article updates.

Learn more about the Guide Team Publishing beta

Answer Bot multi-language support

Answer Bot is currently English only. We will extend the capabilities of Answer Bot to Portuguese and Spanish languages. With high accuracy, Answer Bot will detect the language of the request and suggest articles from the matching locale.

Learn more about the Answer Bot multi-language support early access program

Web Widget performance

The Web Widget performance beta provides early access to performance optimizations that will be released in stages. The first phase of this beta includes a re-architecture to the way we serve the Web Widget.

This beta is great for anyone interested in staying informed about Web Widget performance improvements, getting early access to enhancements, and providing feedback as we roll them out.

Learn more about the Web Widget performance beta

Custom Resources API

The Custom Resources API provides a flexible and relational data store that lives inside Zendesk. It can easily be used from the Zendesk Apps Framework - as well as from external applications - through simple web API requests.

Custom Resources empowers you to model more complicated relationships in Zendesk. The possibilities are endless - from assets for your IT team and product catalogs for your support team, to the zodiac signs of your customers.

Learn more about the Custom Resources API beta

Conference for Talk

The Conference beta (for Talk Professional and Enterprise or Advanced Legacy) enables agents to bring a third party into an ongoing phone call with a customer.

Learn more about the Conference beta

Call blocking for Talk

Ability to block incoming calls is the newest addition to our Talk Advanced feature set, hitting beta now. We have added functionality that allows you to block specific numbers or patterns of numbers that have been flagged by you as being unwanted or fraudulent.

Learn more about the Call blocking beta

Help Center unified search results page

The current Help Center search results page presents results in two columns, when both Knowledge base and Community are enabled. Users can then use pagination controls to view more results.

Rather than having users navigate two results sets at once, we'd like to present the most relevant content from your entire Help Center to your users. We also want to improve the ability for users to navigate a result set by being able to filter based on result type, topic and section. Our goal is to improve the ability of users to quickly and easily find the most relevant content from a Help Center while giving them context into where they're searching.

Learn more about the Help Center search results page beta

Analytical Designer for Insights (Professional and Enterprise)

A new and intuitive way to create reports in Insights, easily and quickly. No more 'What' and 'How', the Analytical Designer is a new environment for flexible data discovery and visualization design that empowers analysts to be more self-sufficient and productive when they create data visualizations.

Learn more about the analytical designer beta

Talk additional numbers now available

We are happy to announce that Zendesk Talk can now offer additional number coverage for the countries listed in the form. Note: These numbers are still in beta and not yet generally available as we want to see how they preform.

Register your interest here

Credit card redaction for Chat

Sometimes agents or customers might send credit card numbers when they should not. The credit card redaction feature will automatically hide credit card numbers during chats and in your chat history. Additionally, redacted credit card numbers will be removed from your database.

Learn more about the credit card redaction beta

articles.name: Community Roundup: January 2018
articles.title: Community Roundup: January 2018
articles.body:
Happy New Year!

It's time for January's Community Roundup!

Our Community is a busy place, so we've gathered up last month's best posts and discussions to make sure you don't miss anything!

Tips & Tricks

Tips & Tricks are custom workarounds or pieces of code shared by our Community members. Here's what they shared in January:

Tips for installing and using the Microsoft VSTS app for Zendesk

  • Here's the first of three amazing tips from new member David Raboy, wherein he gives us some pro-tips on using the Microsoft VSTS app.

How to quickly add an outside (or non-helper) link in your header or other pages in your theme

  • Tip #2 from David Raboy shows us how to add additional links to the header of your Help Center theme.

How to "Send Later" Using Automations

  • Community member Andrew Wilder lays out how to use Automations to create a delayed send functionality in Zendesk.

Trigger for Slack direct message to agent without webhook or integration. Slack has email

  • David Raboy is back with tip #3, outlining how to send an email notification to Slack using native functionality.

Introducing The Lounge

We want our Community to be a place where our customers can connect with other Zendesk users, as well as a place to learn and share knowledge. To that end, we bring you The Lounge!

Welcome to the Zendesk Community - Please introduce yourself!

  • We want to get to know you! Stop in and tell your fellow Community members about yourself.

What are your 2018 Zendesk Goals?

  • We all have them. So let's share them!

Shout-outs and gratitude

  • Want to recognize someone in the Community for being amazing and helpful? This is the place to do it.

Community ZenPets - show us your pets!

  • Here at Zendesk we looooove our pets. We're pretty sure we'll love your pets too, so here's your pet brag zone!

How to get the most out of the Zendesk Community

  • We want our Community to be a helpful resource. Here are some tips for making the most of your time here.

Community Topic Guide: What questions to post where

  • Our Community is a big place, so we've provided a guide to help you figure out where to find what you need.

How to write an effective feedback post and Product Feedback Guidelines

  • Do you have ideas and suggestions for how to make Zendesk better? Here's a guide to help you give truly helpful feedback to our Product Managers.

Zendesk Community Guidelines

  • Every community has their own set of rules; these are ours! Please read through them so we can make sure that everyone has a great Community experience!

Moderator Spotlight

This month we wanted to share a new addition to the Moderator Program - a fancy new badge!

The Community Team worked with Sean Heisler, a graphic designer who has done work for a number of different teams here at Zendesk, and he came up with a design that we just love. Here's what he had to say about it:

"So, the design here are the classic 6-sided star badge style and within it I incorporated a gear element which is indicative of a couple conceptual themes.

A gear symbolizes parts working together and it's also synonymous with software in general. The singular gear can almost be thought of as being representative of the Moderator as they work with the community and are a "pivotal cog."

Also, can you see the little people incorporated into the star tips, going around the icon? The little people are representative of the community and it also looks, abstractly, like they are holding hands.

Again, I like how the little people are incorporated into the cog, where here again it's the interaction between the community and the mod/pivotal cog."

We're really excited about this awesome design, and you can expect to see it incorporated into some elements of the Community sometime in the future.

Interested in learning more about our Community Moderator Program? Meet the Moderators here!

articles.name: Two updates to the sandbox page
articles.title: Two updates to the sandbox page
articles.body:
The Enterprise plan has long provided two help desk instances: a customer-facing production instance, and a development instance known as the sandbox. The sandbox is used to test, learn, and make mistakes before making your changes public.

In December 2017, we made available two updates to the sandbox:

New interface

The first thing you will notice is a new interface. We've replaced the Classic Zendesk admin interface with the updated design that has recently come to other admin areas.

Reset warning

Our customers spend a lot of time and effort on their sandbox. Previously, we didn't warn you when you reset your sandbox, which led to lost time and work. Now, when you click Delete all edits and reset sandbox, you'll be asked to confirm this action:

Getting started

All customers see these two updates to the sandbox.

For admins, our knowledge base article, Testing changes in your sandbox (Enterprise), will get you started.

We think these updates are a great improvement to the sandbox page. 💚 Many thanks to my team and everyone at Zendesk who helped with this release!

articles.name: New ticket field type: Multi-select
articles.title: New ticket field type: Multi-select
articles.body:
In December, we introduced a new ticket field type: Multi-select.

A multi-select field is a ticket field which allows you to choose multiple values from a list. Sometimes end-users or agents creating or updating tickets need to pick several items, and a single answer won't do, or won't be precise enough. For example, when you need to know which Zendesk products you subscribe to:

Getting started

All customers have the ability to create a multi-select ticket field.

For admins, our knowledge base article, Adding custom fields to your tickets and support request forms, will get you started. If you've ever created a drop-down field, you'll have no trouble creating a multi-select field.

Multi-select fields are available on our Support iOS and Android applications.

For developers, our Ticket Fields API documentation will get you started.

Known issues

Conditional Fields app

If you use the Conditional Fields app, multi-select fields are not supported. This app will soon be updated to not display this field type.

Insights

Multi-select fields are not imported into Insights. You can report on the tags that are applied to the ticket. We wrote an Insights recipe to get you started.

Additional knowledge base articles, Reporting on custom fields in Insights (Professional and Enterprise) and Insights tag reporting: Reporting on tickets with one or more tags (Professional and Enterprise), may also help in reporting on this field type.

Placeholders

You can use the ticket.ticket_field_<field ID number> placeholder, but the results will be the tags, not the field values:

Triggers, automations, macros, and SLAs

You can use conditions and actions in triggers, automations, macros, and service level agreements by adding each value as a condition or action:

Note: There is no nullable action for multi-select fields.

Salesforce app

If you use the Salesforce app, multi-select fields are not currently supported.

User and organization fields

Multi-select fields are not available for users and organizations.

Views

Multi-select fields are not supported as a column in a Table style view.

Web Widget

Multi-select fields are not currently supported.

We think the multi-select field is a great addition to our selection of ticket field types and we hope you do too. 💚 Many thanks to my team, everyone at Zendesk who helped, and to all the beta testers for this release!

articles.name: Introducing Answer Bot for Zendesk Web Forms along with new languages
articles.title: Introducing Answer Bot for Zendesk Web Forms along with new languages
articles.body:
We are very excited today to announce the availability of a new experience for Answer Bot specifically designed to work directly in your web forms. Along with this new in-channel experience we also support two new languages, Portuguese and Spanish, allowing Answer Bot to work in more places, and handle more requests than ever before. Answer Bot increases self-service efficiency by responding to customers' questions with relevant knowledge base articles from Zendesk Guide.

Answer Bot for Zendesk Web Forms

Using the same powerful deep learning models, Answer Bot suggests useful articles to customers after they submit their request using web forms. This in-channel experience ensures customers will immediately see suggested articles (when there are relevant matches) right when they need them - customers in the Early Access Program achieved a self-service resolution rate over 18%*.

Keen to get started? Read more about Answer Bot for Web Forms, and enable Answer Bot for your specific forms:

  • Click the Admin icon () in the sidebar, then select Business Rules > Answer Bot.
  • Click Try Answer Bot for 30 days to activate your 30-day trial (if you haven’t already been using it) and follow the on-screen tips to learn about how Answer Bot works.
  • Click on the Web form tab.
  • Turn the global setting for Answer Bot for Web forms on.
  • Activate Answer Bot in each form, for each brand you’d like it to run on.

There's a whole lot more info on Answer Bot in this great resources article and you can read about how to report on Answer Bot’s activity and the new in-channel web form performance.

Extended language support for Portuguese and Spanish

Answer Bot was initially developed and supported on our most common language: English. We’ve extended language support for Answer Bot to include our second and third most common languages, Portuguese and Spanish. When you get a request in any of these languages now, Answer Bot will use its advanced language detection features to accurately establish which language the request is and then find and suggest relevant articles, in that matching language, from your Help Center.

We’ll also be adding further language support in the future, so stay tuned!

Answer Bot plans and subscription management

Answer Bot is an add-on to Guide and requires Guide Professional or Guide Legacy. Find out more about these Guide plans. It's designed to work on any Support plan, however we recommend Support Professional or Enterprise to allow you to access Insights reporting for detailed analysis and performance tracking.

Answer Bot is provided on a usage based subscription model - you can select from a range of monthly resolution limits and only tickets that are solved by Answer Bot count towards that usage limit. A 30 day unlimited trial will allow you fully assess your potential monthly resolutions, and choose the most appropriate limit. Compare all Answer Bot plans and discount tiers.

*Customers surveyed to calculate this rate were limited to EAP customers with over 10 resolutions using Answer Bot

articles.name: Community Roundup: November & December 2017

articles.name: Restricting the visibility of an app by group
articles.title: Restricting the visibility of an app by group
articles.body:
Today we're rolling out a new feature that allows admins to restrict the visibility of an app by group.

This feature allows admins to have more granular control over which apps an agent sees in their user interface.

An app can be group-restricted during the initial installation of the app, or through its settings in Admin > Apps > Manage.

For even more fine-grain control, admins can combine the new group restrictions feature with the existing role restrictions feature.

articles.name: Additional Spam Protection for Help Center
articles.title: Additional Spam Protection for Help Center
articles.body:
We are excited to announce that in addition to using Akismet to help protect our customers from unwanted spam, we will now be using Smyte’s spam filtering services for unrestricted Help Centers. Smyte is a blend of application security, anti-fraud, and content moderation that more effectively combats fraud and abuse. Adding Smyte spam filter will help ensure our spam detection is more accurate.

In order to use this service in your unrestricted Help Center, you must turn on the spam filter. From there all public content submitted by your customers will be filtered through both Akismet and Smyte to determine if it’s spam. Anything caught as spam will be sent to a spam queue where Guide Managers can review and manage them.

If you haven’t already done so, we encourage you to enable the spam filter in your Help Center. Be sure to subscribe to the spam queue to receive notifications when you receive spam. For more information on enabling the spam filter please see our article Using the spam filter to prevent spam in Help Center.

articles.name: Discussion: Share your experience with staffing for Talk
articles.title: Discussion: Share your experience with staffing for Talk
articles.body:
Join our community discussion and tell us about your experience staffing Zendesk Talk. How did you determine the right number of agents and how to schedule them?

Check out our discussion in the community and share!

articles.name: Minor UI design update for the Guide article editor
articles.title: Minor UI design update for the Guide article editor
articles.body:
Today we are releasing some minor UI changes to the Guide article editor. The overall functionality remains the same. We are releasing this update to pave the way for upcoming features that are planned for the article editor and knowledge base.

Here’s the new look for article editing.

New button to save, publish, and unpublish

We’ve introduced a new, larger button that enables you to easily save your changes. The button also consolidates the ability to switch between a draft and a published article. Simply select “Publish” in a draft to publish it or select “Unpublish” in a published article to make it a draft.

More space for authoring and editing

We've expanded the white “paper” background in the article editor. This gives you more room for authoring and editing content so you can focus on the content writing experience.

articles.name: Our Knowledge Roundtable panel shares how they create new content
articles.title: Our Knowledge Roundtable panel shares how they create new content
articles.body:
In our first Knowledge Manager Roundtable our expert panel shares how they create new content. Some of them use KCS principles and some don't. Some have large teams and some work alone. We have it all covered with this panel.

Check out what they share in the Roundtable and share your own experiences in comments.

Meet the panel:

  • Cale Shapera, CX Training and Knowledge Coordinator, Clio
  • Sherri Anderson, Knowledge Manager, Bold Commerce
  • Andrew Schreiner, Support Manager, Episerver
  • Ben Garris and Sarah Boyd, KCS Program Manager - Solve Loop and KCS Program Manager, Republic Wireless

  • Andrei Kamarouski, Business Analytics Director and Co-founder, smm3
  • Anton Maslov, Operations Manager, Plesk
  • Rory O'Connor, Knowledge and Process Program Manager, Box

  • Mary Paez and Sahar Padesh, Knowledge Manager and Support Operations Manager, Veeva

articles.name: Introducing the new theming experience for Zendesk Guide
articles.title: Introducing the new theming experience for Zendesk Guide
articles.body:
I’m very excited to announce the release of a new theme editing and authoring experience in Zendesk Guide. These new customization options overhaul the Guide theming infrastructure and introduce a streamlined user interface, improved theme editor, and many new developer-focused features.

For Guide account admins, you can now duplicate or create themes easily. This gives you the ability to stage and preview changes safely and test how things will work before you make them public.

For theme developers, themes are now a package of templates, CSS, and JavaScript. You can import and export themes, check them into version control, and build themes offline. You can edit theme manifest files to add or remove settings. We’ve also significantly improved the code editor and preview components.

Read on to see What's changed and how to Get the new features.

What's changed

Here are more details about the theming improvements for administrators and developers.

New interface

  • Themes page - New overview screen shows all of your themes and enables you to easily manage multiple themes, stage changes, and publish changes live when they are ready.
  • Preview - Faster, better preview experience for themes.
  • Code editor - Improved code editor allows for opening multiple files in tabs and has an integrated preview, search, and more to feel more like a full development experience.

Theme management

  • Create or duplicate a theme - Easily work with a number of unpublished themes in Guide, so that you can build, preview, and update themes without fear of accidentally publishing or losing work.
  • Import and export a theme - Import and export themes from Guide as zip files of templates, CSS, JavaScript, and asset files. This makes themes easy to back up and enables you to work on themes offline in your favorite editor.

Developer features

  • Distributable theme packages - Theme packages are now zip archives of templates, JavaScript, CSS, and assets so you can import and export themes between brands or work with them outside of the browser.
  • Editable manifest files - Edit theme manifest files to add or remove settings and completely customize your theme. These settings can be used in CSS, JavaScript, and template files.
  • Updated template helpers and objects -
    • New settings object is a custom object defined in the theme's manifest.json file.
    • New json_stringify helper converts a normal string into a JSON string that you can use in your JavaScript.

You can learn more about how to use all of these features in our Guide theming documentation.

Get the new theming features

Customers who enabled Guide on or after November 14, 2017 will have access to these theme customization options.

Customers who enabled Guide before November 14, 2017 need to migrate to the new theming experience.

To upgrade your theming experience:

  1. In Guide, click the Customize design icon () in the sidebar.
  2. Click the Upgrade now button.
  3. If you have multiple themes, select the themes you want to migrate.
  4. Click Migrate your themes.

If you have multiple brands, you’ll need to complete the upgrade for each Help Center.

articles.name: Community Roundup: October 2017
articles.title: Community Roundup: October 2017
articles.body:
It's time for October's Community Roundup!

The Zendesk Community is a busy place, so we've gathered up the month's best posts and discussions to make sure you don't miss anything!

Tips & Tricks

Tips & Tricks are custom workarounds or pieces of code shared by our Community members. Here's what was shared in October:

API Sample (C#) of how to Upload Attachments to the Help Center (Guide)

Adding Synonym Sets to Help Center search for Guide

Show promoted articles of viewing category on category template

Insert Google Translate widget to your Helpcenter

How to add a cool-down period to satisfaction surveys

  • Community Member Nadia De Vriendt shows us how to add a CSAT survey cooldown using tags, triggers, and automations in her very first Tip.

Best Practices for Creating a Powerful Zendesk Community

Hiding Ticket Forms for Anonymous Users

Sending Custom Ticket Fields via an HTTP Extension

  • New Community Member Brandon Young lays out how to to send custom ticket fields using an HTTP extension.

What should we call you?

Our Community Members need a name!
Give us your suggestions below!

Zendesk Self-Service Newsletter

Our first ever Self-Service newsletter will be launching soon! Sign up below to have the very best content from Knowledge and Community delivered straight to your inbox!

Discussions

Want to re-live those spooky Halloween memories? Read about some scary tickets, and feel free to add your own:

  • Tell us about your scary tickets! Halloween 2017 edition

Thinking about using our Knowledge Capture app? Find out how we use here at Zendesk:

  • Zendesk on Zendesk: How we use the Knowledge Capture app

Moderator Showcase

We're delighted to welcome another new member to our Community Moderator family!

Trapta became a Zendesk Community Moderator on September 28, 2017!

Trapta works as a web developer for a company that uses Zendesk to create Help Centers and integrations, and we're so lucky that she brings her knowledge and experience in this area to our Community!

Trapta says that she thinks some web developers must be magicians, like Harry Potter, using spells to make different parts of their designs move and animate. If that's the case, then she's quite the coding wizard herself!

Be sure to give her a warm welcome when you see her around the Community!

Want to know more about our Community Moderators? Wondering how to become one? Get that info here!

articles.name: New in Zendesk Talk: new and updated Talk Stats APIs
articles.title: New in Zendesk Talk: new and updated Talk Stats APIs
articles.body:
We know that our native Talk dashboard can’t fulfill every use case, which is why we’ve updated our Talk Stats APIs to return even more metrics that you can use to build your own custom dashboards.

Here’s what’s changed!

Account Overview endpoint

api/v2/channels/voice/stats/account_overview.json

We’ve created a new endpoint to return all the data necessary for you to get an overview of what’s happening in your Talk account for the current day. This endpoint exposes the metrics that are displayed in the Overview section of the native dashboard. The data is displayed as for the current day and you can filter this endpoint by phone_number_ids.

Agents Overview endpoint

/api/v2/channels/voice/stats/agents_overview.json

We created another new endpoint to show aggregated information of all of your agents. The data is displayed as for the current day.

Agents Activity endpoint

/api/v2/channels/voice/stats/agents_activity.json

We added a bunch of new metrics to this existing endpoint. You can now get more data about your individual agents, as separate to the aggregated data that’s displayed in agents_overview.json. The data is displayed as for the current day and you can filter this endpoint by group_ids. Metrics like {status} are updated in near real-time.

Current Queue Activity endpoint

/api/v2/channels/voice/stats/current_queue_activity.json

This endpoint hasn't gone through any changes but is there for you monitor your current Talk queue in near real-time.

Here's an awesome example of what you can build using our APIs, from our partner Geckoboard.

Developer documentation

You can find documentation on all Talk endpoints on developer.zendesk.com.

Availability

The endpoints are accessible to customers on Talk Team, Professional and Enterprise plans. You’ll be able to view the keys that are applicable to your plan in each endpoint.

Deprecation notice

As part of this announcement we’d also like to announce the deprecation of /api/v2/channels/voice/stats/historical_queue_activity.json. The information returned in this endpoint is now made obsolete with the release of account_overview.json and it will be formally removed on November 24th 2017.

After this date you will no longer be able to pull information from the historical_queue_activity.

articles.name: Announcing video embedding in the Guide article editor
articles.title: Announcing video embedding in the Guide article editor
articles.body:
Today we’re happy to announce the ability for customers to easily embed videos from popular video sites into their articles, without accessing the article code or enabling the Display Unsafe Content option.

The video providers we support out of the box are:

  • YouTube
  • Vimeo
  • Wistia
  • JWPlayer
  • Brightcove

In the article editor, you will see a new icon for adding videos.

Clicking this button opens a menu where you can enter the URL of the video that you’d like to embed. After you enter the URL, a preview of the video displays in the modal window.

Then you can click to insert the video in your article. The video is embedded at the cursor in the article body.

When you are ready, you can publish your new video in your Help Center.

articles.name: Announcing JIRA App v4
articles.title: Announcing JIRA App v4
articles.body:
October 20th, 2017

We're excited to announce a redesign of the JIRA app for Zendesk Support. Version 4 adds many long-awaited usability improvements, like the user configurable issue creation form. The app is now also faster, better looking, and more functional.

Main new features

  • Admins can configure which fields appear on the JIRA issue creation form in Support.
  • Keywords search for JIRA issues when from Support.
  • Ticket information can be automatically copied to the issue creation form.
  • Improved performance and usability thanks to the new Zendesk Apps framework.

Configurable issue creation from

There is now an easy way to define which JIRA fields an agent sees when creating a new JIRA issue from Support, a significant enhancement introduced in the JIRA app v4.

These fields are specific to a particular JIRA project and issue type. Issue fields defined as "required" in JIRA will appear on the form regardless of configurations on this form.

Note that only Support admins can configure these fields for their agents.

All existing installations have been updated to the latest version of the JIRA app. No customer action is required.

For information on working with the new app, see Setting up the JIRA for Zendesk Support integration and Using the JIRA for Zendesk Support integration.

FAQ

Q: Can I use both the old app (v3) and the new one (v4) at the same time?

A: App v4 is designed to supersede the previous version. This means that after the upgrade to v4, the previous version will no longer be available.

Q: Do I need to do anything after upgrading to v4?

A: The app will configured automatically and ready to use. Admins can take advantage of the new features like configuring the form fields.

Q: Has any feature been removed from the app v4?

A: The updated app is superset of the previously available features.

articles.name: Announcing HTML headings in the Guide article editor
articles.title: Announcing HTML headings in the Guide article editor
articles.body:
I’m happy to announce today that we’re releasing the ability for customers to insert HTML Heading tags using the Guide article editor. You can select H1 through H4 to use in your aricles.

HTML Heading tags give your content structure, they are readable by web crawlers, screen readers, etc., and they provide block level formatting for your articles.

We still provide text size selections of small through huge if you simply need to modify the size of text, especially if you need multiple font sizes on the same line.

You can select your heading tags from the drop-down menu in the article editor:

The HTML output looks like this:

articles.name: Community Roundup: September 2017
articles.title: Community Roundup: September 2017
articles.body:
It's time for September's Community Roundup!

The Zendesk Community is a busy place, so we've gathered up the month's best posts and discussions to make sure you don't miss anything!

Tips & Tricks

Tips & Tricks are custom workarounds or pieces of code shared by our Community members. Here's what was shared in September:

Mink: Brand New Zendesk Theme Ready to Download

  • Long time Community Member Lotus Themes shares 'Mink', a beautiful new Guide theme.

Using SendGrid for outgoing emails (notifications) - HTTP Target + Triggers

  • Community star Diziana shows us how to send email notifications from Zendesk via SendGrid.

Displaying Top Articles on Category and Section Pages

  • Sherri Anderson nails it with her very first Community Tip, sharing how to display your top articles on your Category and Section pages in Guide.

How to make Zendesk emails work for your brand

  • Do your email templates need some TLC? Lotus Team is back with some best practices to make sure your emails reflect your company's brand.

Trigger recipe: Set priority based on key words in incoming tickets

  • Community Moderator Graeme Carmichael shares a workflow to help make sure your tickets get routed and prioritized correctly.

Restricting Satisfaction Surveys by Date

  • Do your customers often submit multiple tickets? Do you want to make sure they're not overwhelmed with multiple satisfaction surveys? Graeme Carmichael collaborates with fellow Moderator Joel Hellman to show you how to take control of those surveys.

Zendesk Self-Service Newsletter

We're excited to announce our first ever Self-Service newsletter will be launching in October! We'll be curating the very best content from Knowledge and Community, inspired by a new theme each month. Sign up below to have this great resource delivered straight to your inbox!

Discussions

We love conversations. Give us your thoughts on this interesting one from September:

  • Managing Links

Preparing for GDPR in 2018? So are we! Here's where we're at:

  • General Data Protection Regulation 2018 - the right to be forgotten

Want to make sure your Support Team is up to snuff? Conchita from Customer Success has some best practices for you:

  • Fine Tuning: Evaluate your Support Organization to Find (and Eliminate) Gaps

Have a clever trigger or automation that's made your life easier? Share it with the Community for a chance to get some swag!

  • Share your favorite triggers and automations!

Questions

Do you have questions? The Community has answers! Here are some we thought were extra helpful:

  • How can I automatically CC based on domain?
  • Translating Help Center Content

Moderator Showcase

We're delighted to welcome another new member to our Community Moderator family!

Heather R became a Zendesk Community Moderator on September 12, 2017!

Heather says that Zendesk plays a crucial role in her company’s day-to-day work, in both IT Service Desk and non-service desk departments that interact with the same user base. Her areas of Zendesk expertise include Guide and Support, especially using triggers and macros to customize Zendesk for more than 100 agents representing 4 departments with different preferences and business processes.

More about Heather:

I went on Outward Bound when I was 16, sailing the seas for two weeks in Maine. There is only one sunrise that rivals the Maine sunrise, and that is in Maui. Nothing makes the world sweeter than a cup of coffee in the morning and a smile from my kids. Not necessarily in that order, but maybe. And there is literally no place I’d rather be than on the beach, my toes in the sand and a fishing pole in my hand. I don’t know what I want to be when I grow up. All I know is I started with a psychology degree and ended up in IT with a PMP. How did this happen?

Be sure to give her a warm welcome when you see her around the Community!

Want to know more about our Community Moderators? Wondering how to become one? Get that info here!

articles.name: Check out Zendesk on Zendesk: How we use Knowledge Capture app
articles.title: Check out Zendesk on Zendesk: How we use Knowledge Capture app
articles.body:
This Zendesk on Zendesk session is hosted by Melissa Burch, Manager of our Online Customer Service team. This session is about how our Zendesk Support Advocates team implemented and now use the Guide Knowledge Capture app, including:

  • Our vision for KCS
  • Planning a successful implementation
  • Putting our plan into action
  • Encouraging ongoing engagement

Check out the discussion in our community! Melissa is standing by to answer your questions. And be sure to share your own experiences as well.

articles.name: Check out Fine Tuning: Evaluate your Support organization
articles.title: Check out Fine Tuning: Evaluate your Support organization
articles.body:
This month's Fine Tuning session is hosted by Conchita on our Customer Success team.

Conchita covers how you can assess your support organization, including:

  • Common misconceptions and mindsets to avoid
  • Taking a realistic look at your organization's maturity level
  • Keeping current in the ever-changing world of support

Check out the discussion in our community. You can participate by adding a comment to ask a question or to share your own experience.

articles.name: Update to end-user behavior
articles.title: Update to end-user behavior
articles.body:
We were made aware of an existing vulnerability in our end user log-in flow, also known as the “Ticket Trick” Vulnerability. This vulnerability would allow hackers to sign up to a company’s help center and use the unverified email provided to access that company’s Yammer or Slack instances.

In an effort to make Zendesk more secure and protect our customers from this vulnerability, end users who were created after September 17, 2017 need to verify their email address to view the tickets they submitted. This fix does not affect accounts that use SAML or JWT for their end user log in, as those users are automatically verified by the identity provider upon sign in.

If end-users have not verified their email address and try to access their requests in Help Center, they'll see the following error with a link to have the email verification resent to them:

For the various methods of verifying an user email address, see this article in the Support Help Center.

We recommend making sure you have the appropriate triggers enabled (for example: "Notify requester of comment update" trigger) to ensure your end users are notified by email when there's an update to their request. For more information on triggers, see Creating and managing triggers for ticket updates and notifications.

articles.name: Zendesk Guide: Announcing the Knowledge Capture app
articles.title: Zendesk Guide: Announcing the Knowledge Capture app
articles.body:
In May we launched an early access program for the Knowledge Capture app, and I want to kick off this announcement by thanking each of you who participated. Your usage and feedback have shaped the Knowledge Capture app into what it is today.

Improving how your teams find, use, improve and create knowledge is something we will continue to improve, and the Knowledge Capture app is a part of that journey.

Today, we are happy to announce the release of the Knowledge Capture app as part of Guide Professional. For many of you who are being introduced to Knowledge Capture for the first time, the Knowledge Capture app leverages your support team’s collective knowledge and enables agents link to articles in tickets, create new Help Center content, and flag content for improvements, directly from the Zendesk Support agent interface.

It’s important to note that the Knowledge Capture app is not, nor is it intended to be a KCS certified product. We believe there is a lot of value in the KCS principles and we have focused on unleashing that value with the Knowledge Capture app, but we are not currently checking off a KCS v.6 compliance checklist.

What is the Knowledge Capture app

The app enables your agents to improve knowledge as they go, by capturing collective knowledge and building on it over time to respond to support requests more effectively. Using the app, agents can:

  • Search the Help Center without leaving the ticket
  • Insert links to relevant Help Center articles in ticket comments
  • Associate internal or access restricted articles to a ticket even if they are not sent to your customer
  • Add inline feedback to existing articles that need updates
  • Create new articles while answering tickets, using a pre-defined template
  • Switch language or brand

How to get the Knowledge Capture app

You must have Guide Professional to use the Knowledge Capture app. You must be on Support Professional or Enterprise to use the Knowledge Capture app reporting dashboard.

You can get the app from the Zendesk Apps Marketplace, in the self-service category. The Knowledge Capture app can replace other apps you may have installed, including the Answer Suggestion app and the Ticket to Help Center app.

To install the app and plan your workflows, see:

  • Installing the Knowledge Capture app
  • Workflows for created and flagged articles

To use the app, see:

  • Searching and linking articles
  • Adding feedback to flag articles
  • Creating articles based on tickets
  • Analyzing Knowledge Capture activity

articles.name: Updated: Revision History for Triggers
articles.title: Updated: Revision History for Triggers
articles.body:
Updated January 2018! We've made some enhancements to this feature since it was launched in October 2017: now you can see what changed from the previous version, and the ticket event log links to the specific trigger version that ran. This article has been updated accordingly, as has our general trigger management documentation.

Enterprise customers: now you can see a history of your trigger updates!

We’ve added this capability in order to give you more confidence when updating triggers, and to give you more tools for troubleshooting. It will also provide more accountability, especially for teams where multiple people are updating business rules.

From now on, we'll be keeping track of configuration changes made to your individual triggers. We’ll record who made the change, when it was made, and the exact trigger configuration. You can access that history right from the trigger’s edit page. It’ll be available to anyone with permission to manage business rules.

Just click on the link that appears below the trigger title:

When you get to the history page, you’ll see all the available versions in a sidebar. Click on the one you’re interested in, and here's what you'll see:

For now, just changing the position of a trigger won’t be counted as a revision.

While we won't have history going back before this feature was released in October 2017, we did include the current version of each trigger as the first recorded version. The revision is listed as having been made “by Zendesk.”

New in January 2018! If the trigger appears in the ticket event log, the link is a unique URL that goes directly to the version that ran (rather than always going to the current version).

If you find this feature valuable, be sure to let us know here in the comments! It’ll help us prioritize adding revision history to other workflow tools, like automations and views.

articles.name: Announcing Zendesk Talk Enterprise
articles.title: Announcing Zendesk Talk Enterprise
articles.body:
The Talk team is excited to announce the launch of Talk Enterprise, our new pricing plan that provides growing teams and call centers with the tools and hands-on support they need to successfully deliver phone support at scale.

Talk Enterprise includes all the features on Talk Professional, plus:

Launch Success Program

Get off on the right with hands-on deployment support from Zendesk experts. The Zendesk team will help companies define business goals, optimize their network and environment, configure their Talk instance and review supervisor features.

Monthly diagnostics

Monthly diagnostics provides a deep-dive on performance and expert guidance to help teams troubleshoot and prevent outages. This service includes (learn more):

  • Diagnostic reports containing actionable information regarding Talk performance, like connection failure causes, terminations errors and network issues
  • Monthly consultative call with a Zendesk Talk expert to review these reports in detail, answer any questions and provide suggestions for system improvements

Usage SLA

The Talk Enterprise Usage SLA covers any outages due to our service provider’s (Twilio) API, which will trigger a usage credit (this credit is applied towards Talk usage, and will not apply the Talk agent license subscription). Learn more.

Failover-on-demand

In the event of a site-specific outage that impacts Talk connectivity, customers may request “failover on-demand” to route calls to an alternate number. Learn more.


As part of the introduction of Talk Enterprise, we’re also announcing an update to our other Talk pricing plans and packages.

As we continue to evolve the Zendesk family of products, it’s important that we align all the different elements of our brand. This includes our plan names. So, we’ve decided to rename the legacy Zendesk Talk plans.

As of September 6th, 2017, Zendesk Talk has the following renamed plans:

  • Lite
  • Team
  • Professional
  • Enterprise

You can view the features available by plan type on the Zendesk Talk pricing page.

FAQs

How do I know which plan I am on?

In general, if you purchased Talk before September 6th, 2017, you will be on the legacy plans.

Already a paying customer? Nothing’s changing for you.

If you’re a paying customer as of September 6th, 2017, the plan and pricing changes do not affect you at all.

You are grandfathered into your existing plan and your current pricing and packaging.

Can I upgrade/downgrade to legacy plans rather than switching to the new plans?

Customers can stay with the plan they are on! You will need to shift to our new plan structure if you choose to upgrade or downgrade plans.

Are you planning to remove the legacy plans?

We are not planning to remove any of our legacy plans from existing customers.

When I come up for renewal, will I be able to stay on my existing plan?

Yes.

What if I want to add/remove agents but not change plans?

As long as you don’t change the plan you are on, you can add or remove as many agents as you like and you will remain on the plan you are on.

Is there a benefit to changing plans?

If you’d like to upgrade to more features and functionality or if you’re not using all the features and functionality of your existing Zendesk plan, then you may want to consider switching to one of our new plans.
